Articles.Content:
Is rocket fuel so clear that you can actually see that view?

That's LOX.
"Rocket made it to drone spaceport ship, but landed hard. Close, but no cigar this time. Bodes well for the future tho." - Elon Musk's Twitter

uff, I dont know how elon musk resist this pressure in each launch.

Well mission sucessful, now we need to wait to hear something about the first stage.
Was I the only one who couldn't help but think of Kent Brockman's infamous ants upon seeing those fuel droplets in zero g?
I think in about 20 minutes the 1st stage landed or not. We'll see...

SpaceX is waiting for an update from recovery team. More info at press conference later.

Privately, i think it's a bit of PR bovine metabolic product. In the era of sat phones i bet someone already phoned with "We got it!", or "Sorry, it sank."
1st stage made it to ship, but landed hard apparently

"Rocket made it to drone spaceport ship, but landed hard. Close, but no cigar this time. Bodes well for the future tho." - Elon Musk's Twitter

confirmed!
They are saying on twitter 'Close but no cigar'

[h=3]Landing Update[/h]Rocket made it to drone spaceport ship, but landed hard. Close, but no cigar this time. Bodes well for the future though.

via SpaceX
I wish we can see a record of the landing.
Landed hard on the barge. Thats gonna leave mark.

"Landed hard"

That doest sound healthy, if it crashed with terminal velocity the droneship will be heavy damaged...
RIP SpaceX SpaceBarge.
Well, the important thing is that it hits the mark. That is quite difficult to achieve.
"Ship itself is fine. Some of the support equipment on the deck will need to be replaced..." - Elon Musk's Twitter

Ship itself is fine. Some of the support equipment on the deck will need to be replaced...

From Elon Musk's twitter.

RIP SpaceX SpaceBarge.
Ship itself is fine. Some of the support equipment on the deck will need to be replaced...
Elon Musk

Great launch SpaceX.
Well, they successfully hit their target and apparently the rocket itself survived. Any landing you can walk away from...
Sounds like a potential crash on the barge, but at least they hit their mark.

wow those are good news

I will call that sucessful from my kerbal point of view.

Imagine doing that in KSP.

I think a lot of explosions will be involved.
Didn't get good landing/impact video. Pitch dark and foggy. Will piece it together from telemetry and ... actual pieces.

"Didn't get good landing/impact video. Pitch dark and foggy. Will piece it together from telemetry and ... actual pieces." - Elon Musk's Twitter

*EDIT* Ninja'd
